nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.maze

Interface Move

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SingleMove

    public interface Move
    Groups the behaviour required by all type of movements.
     

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Move.Direction
      Directions in which a move could be made.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Board apply(Board board)
      Apply a move to a new board and returns it.
      java.awt.Point getDestination(java.awt.Point old)
      Get the new coordinates of where this move brings.
      Move.Direction getLastDirection()
      Get the direction the last step is pointing to.
      default java.util.List<java.awt.Point> stepsTaken()
      Get the coordinates of the cell the entity passed through while moving.

    • Method Detail

      • getDestination

        java.awt.Point getDestination(java.awt.Point old)
        Get the new coordinates of where this move brings.
        Parameters:
        old - location before the move is applied
        Returns:
        new location

      • getLastDirection

        Move.Direction getLastDirection()
        Get the direction the last step is pointing to. It can be used to know where the player will be facing
        Returns:
        were the move is going to

      • stepsTaken

        default java.util.List<java.awt.Point> stepsTaken()
        Get the coordinates of the cell the entity passed through while moving. If only one step is made in a move getDestination will be sufficient. This method had been included in the interface for when multiple step moves will be added. In that case knowing the steps taken will be required for displaying the path taken.
        Returns:
        the ordered list of coordinates for each visited tile

      • apply

        default Board apply(Board board)
        Apply a move to a new board and returns it.
        Parameters:
        board - the current state of the board
        Returns:
        a new board where the move have been applied
